results.name: University_of_Colorado_Boulder_Campus_Map
results.title: University of Colorado Boulder Campus Map
results.description: The University of Colorado Boulder campus map is created, updated and published by the CU CAD/GIS Office. It consists of twenty-two separate feature classes: Property Boundaries, Building Footprints, River Lines, Lakes and Ponds, Ditches, Water Features, Dams, Road Edges, Sidewalk Edges, Structure Areas and Lines, Athletics Fields & Courts, Athletics Lines, Fence Lines, Outdoor Spaces, Parking Lots and Lines, Grounds Panels (softscape areas), Road Centerlines, Trees and Points of Interest. Each of these layers are updated as-needed by the CU CAD/GIS Office when new information is received, typically in the form of construction as-built drawings. The updates are posted to ArcGIS Online, Esri Living Atlas and Esri Community maps at least twice a year, quarterly when possible.
results.snippet: The University of Colorado Boulder campus map is created, updated and published by the CU CAD/GIS Office. It consists of twenty feature classes that make up the campus basic geography and is published primarily for use by the campus community.
results.accessInformation: CAD/GIS Office  |  University of Colorado Boulder  |  https://www.colorado.edu/gis-cad/
results.licenseInfo: This data is intended for use by and for the University of Colorado Boulder community. This data may not be republished without express permission by the Campus CAD/GIS Office, except if used for academic purposes provided that the data source is properly cited (see Credits listed on this page). If you would like to use this data for non-academic purposes, for example providing services to the University of Colorado Boulder, please contact us at fmcad@colorado.edu for approval.

results.name: Boulder_CO_Buildings
results.title: City of Boulder, CO Buildings
results.description:
This layer contains pre-processed building footprints for Boulder, Colorado. This data was shared by the City as open data through the Esri Community Maps program and its new option for data sharing.

This layer contains 39,180 buildings for the City, many of which do not already exist as building features in OpenStreetMap (OSM). The buildings for the City include a few fields (building, addr:state, name) that have been prepared to be added as tags in OSM.

The processed building footprints referenced above were created using these Esri Data Processing Steps for Buildings and Addresses, developed and refined while doing data prep for several city and county communities in the United States.

OSM Editor Tools
This layer is accessible through new tools in OSM editors (e.g. updated version of RapiD) that enable OSM mappers to display the features on a map, select an individual feature to inspect its geometry and tags, and then use the feature for editing. OSM mappers should review the individual features and tags, and make any edits and additions that are appropriate, before selecting other features to edit and uploading edits to OSM.
results.snippet: This layer contains building footprints for Boulder, Colorado that have been prepared to be added to OpenStreetMap.
results.accessInformation: Esri Community Maps Contributors; Boulder, CO
results.licenseInfo:
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons by Attribution (CC BY 4.0) license. See Credits for Attribution.

View License Deed | View Legal Code

With respect to the Esri Community Maps dataset, Esri and the Esri Community Maps Contributors agree to the following:

1. Attribution by OpenStreetMap and its users through https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Contributors is sufficient to provide attribution to Esri Community Maps Contributors in a "reasonable manner" in accordance with Section 3(a)(1) of the CC BY 4.0 license.

2. Esri waives Section 2(a)(5)(B) of the CC BY 4.0 license as to OpenStreetMap and its users with the understanding that the Open Database License 1.0 requires open access or parallel distribution of OpenStreetMap data.

results.title: Pharmacies that Provide Narcan in Boulder County
results.description:
Narcan is a drug used to reverse an overdose from opioids (heroin, narcotics). Boulder County Public Health is working to train members of the community who are at a high likelihood of being in the presence of someone who might overdose. This map shows the locations of pharmacies that provide Narcan.

Click on the RX symbol to display a pop up window with more information on the pharmacy - including the phone number to call ahead to ensure availability.

Click on the Near Me button to find pharmacies near you. Enter your starting address and the map will find the locations near your starting address. A pop up window will display with the location information including the phone number. Use the Directions tab to get directions to this location.

Click on the Share Map button to share using Google+, Email, Facebook, and Twitter.

PRINT button to print the map - Note this button does not print the list at the bottom of the page. To export the list as a CSV file, click the options arrow, then export to CSV.

You can then open the file in Excel, NotePad, Word, etc. to view and print.
results.snippet: A mapping application to give directions to pharmacies that provide Narcan (Naloxone) as a response to opioid overdose in Boulder County, CO
results.licenseInfo: <font size='3'>Boulder County makes no warranties regarding the accuracy, completeness, reliability, or suitability of its data or maps. The county disclaims any liability associated with the use or misuse of its data or maps. In accessing data or maps, the user fully assumes any and all risk associated with the information contained therein.</font>

results.title: Lost Lake Boulder Guide
results.description: Welcome to the fully interactive web map bouldering guide for the Lost Lake Boulder Area! This creation is a collaborative effort between Alicia Milligan (GIS wiz) and Michael Brady (guide book author). We hope you will find the most accurate and feature rich information about the Lost Lake Boulders. This guide thoroughly covers information about each field, boulder area, each boulder, every route, beta, photos, boulder topos and links to the climbs on Mountain Project. As this area grows and develops please feel free to email me updates or corrections at ahelms@pdx.edu. Enjoy exploring and get psyched to go climb!
results.snippet: Welcome to the fully interactive web map bouldering guide for Lost Lake Boulders, Hood River County, Oregon.
results.accessInformation:
Map and datasets created by: Alicia Milligan (ahelms@pdx.edu) Route Data authored by: Michael Brady. Hand drawn topographic base map illustrated by: Alicia Milligan. Trail dataset from: USFS. Water dataset from: USGS hydrology. Photo Credits: (view photo credit on popups. 

Mountain Project Links: 
 https://www.mountainproject.com/v/lost-lake-boulders/109103886.

Lost Lake Resort Link: 
 http://lostlakeresort.org/.

Mt. Hood National Forest Link: 
 https://www.fs.usda.gov/detail/mthood/alerts-notices/?cid=stelprdb5191108.
results.licenseInfo: This guide is free and open to use and share. If there is information in the data that needs updating or if new climbs are put up, contact Alicia Milligan at ahelms@pdx.edu.

results.name: WFP_CommunityChippingProgram2021
results.title: Boulder County 2021 Community Chipping Zone locations
results.description:
A Feature Layer displaying the locations of 2021 Boulder County Community Chipping Zones.

• The Feature Layer was created for Wildfire Partners and Boulder County Community Planning & Permitting Department and in conjunction with the Boulder County Community Chipping Map Viewer, serves as a tool for eligible residents to identify which Chipping Zones they are located in and dates the chipping crews will be in each zone.

• Wildfire Partners is a mitigation program to help homeowners prepare for wildfire. As part of Boulder County’s Community Planning & Permitting Department, we assist all mountain and foothills residents throughout the county. Wildfire Partners is a nationally recognized model for wildfire mitigation that is incorporated into Boulder County's building code.

https://www.wildfirepartners.org/
results.snippet: Boulder County 2021 Community Chipping Zone locations.
results.accessInformation: Boulder County Planning & Permitting GIS, Wildfire Partners
results.licenseInfo: DISCLAIMER: This map is for illustrative purposes only and the features depicted on it are approximate. More site specific studies may be required to draw accurate conclusions. Boulder County makes no warranties regarding the accuracy, completeness, reliability, or suitability of this map. Boulder County disclaims any liability associated with the use or misuse of this map. In accessing and/or relying on this map, the user fully assumes any and all risk associated with the information contained therein

results.name: FireProtectionDistricts
results.title: Boulder County Fire Protection Districts
results.description:
A Feature Layer displaying the locations of each Fire Protection District in Boulder County.

• The Fire Protection Districts are officially known as Fire Taxation Districts.

• There are 22 Fire Taxation Districts and 2 Non-Taxation Districts (Big Elk Meadows and Rocky Mountain National Park Fire). This Feature Layer DOES NOT represent Fire Response Districts.

• This Feature Layer does not display Fire Districts in some incorporated areas of Boulder County.
results.snippet: Boulder County Fire Protection District locations.
results.accessInformation: Boulder County Assessor GIS, Boulder County Planning & Permitting GIS, Wildfire Partners
results.licenseInfo: DISCLAIMER: This map is for illustrative purposes only and the features depicted on it are approximate. More site specific studies may be required to draw accurate conclusions. results.title: Pharmacies that Provide Narcan in Boulder County
results.description: Narcan is a drug used to reverse an overdose from opioids (heroin, narcotics). Boulder County Public Health is working to train members of the community who are at a high likelihood of being in the presence of someone who might overdose.  This map shows the locations of pharmacies that provide Narcan.  Click on the RX symbol to display a pop up window with more information on the pharmacy. Click on the blue "Get Directions" text at the bottom of the pop up window to get directions from your starting location to the drop off location. It is strongly recommended that you call the pharmacy ahead of time to ensure availability of Narcan.
results.snippet: A map showing the locations of pharmacies that provide Narcan (Naloxone) as a response to opioid overdose in Boulder County, CO

results.title: Boulder County Wildfires
results.description: A Story Map to outline some of the most recent fires in Boulder County and highlight the effect they had on the people and the land. The app includes links to videos, websites, PDFs, and other interactive maps. Click on the orange text in each section to navigate to these additional links.
results.snippet: A Story Map to outline some of the most recent fires in Boulder County and highlight the effect they had on the people and the land.

results.name: M05_Place_Vulnerability_Analysis_Boulder_CO
results.title: M05 Place Vulnerability Analysis Boulder CO
results.description:
Determine and understand the Place Vulnerability (based on Cutter et al. 1997) and the LifeLines for Boulder County (Colorado, USA) based on its Flood Hazard Zones, its Social Vulnerability Index, and the distribution of its Population and Housing units.

This Hosted Feature Layer is the results of a Place Vulnerability Analysis completed using the ArcGIS Pro Place Vulnerability Analysis Solution by NAPSG Foundation.
results.snippet: Results of Place Vulnerability Analysis for Boulder, Colorado based on its Flood Hazard Zones, its Social Vulnerability Index, and the distribution of its Population and Housing units.
results.licenseInfo: This Hosted Feature Layer is used as an example for the 430.621 GIS for Emergency Management course at Johns Hopkins University.This is not intended for real-world decision making. If you have questions please send an email with a link to this item to Paul J. Doherty, pjdoherty@jhu.edu.
